articles.title: I will never forget what he did for me - Xhaka on Arteta
articles.summary: Granit Xhaka speaks to Kelly Somers to discuss why he chose to play for Sunderland and his relationship with his former Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

articles.title: A result that puts Leeds safe, Forest in trouble - and Dyche in doubt?
articles.summary: After Leeds' win over Nottingham Forest on Friday, BBC Sport looks at what it all means for the Premier League relegation battle.

articles.title: From £70 a week to brink of Premier League record 24 years later
articles.summary: James Milner will equal the Premier League appearance record if he features for Brighton on Sunday, 24 years after making his debut as a 16-year-old.

articles.title: Saudi to offload Ronaldo for £43m - Saturday's gossip
articles.summary: Saudi Pro League is ready to offload Cristiano Ronaldo for £43m, Chelsea set to rival Tottenham for Dusan Vlahovic, while Sergio Ramos offers his services to Marseille, plus more.

articles.title: Leeds beat Forest to move clear of relegation zone
articles.summary: Leeds United move nine points clear of the Premier League's relegation zone, with a dominant 3-1 win over fellow strugglers Nottingham Forest.

articles.title: 'Football aspect of Liverpool season not so important after Jota'
articles.summary: Former Liverpool goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher says performances and results at his old club are not quite as important this season following the death of Diogo Jota.

articles.title: 'Why young British managers need lower-league experience'
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why he thinks there is a negative reaction to British managers when they get jobs in the Premier League - and the path young coaches...

articles.title: Bompastor extends Chelsea contract until 2030
articles.summary: Chelsea head coach Sonia Bompastor signs a contract extension with the Women's Super League club until 2030.

articles.title: 'Leicester dream torn apart by unprecedented spending'
articles.summary: Leicester, Premier League champions a decade ago, face a relegation fight after being docked 10 points for financial rule breaches.

articles.title: Oxlade-Chamberlain ready for short-term Celtic move, says O'Neill
articles.summary: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will have a medical on Saturday before signing with Celtic for the remainder of the season, says manager Martin O'Neill.

articles.title: Ex-players have 'duty of responsibility' as pundits - Van Dijk
articles.summary: Former players turned pundits have a "duty of responsibility" to the new generation of footballers when commenting on their performances, Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says.

articles.title: Fiery scenes in stands halt Bundesliga match

articles.title: 'Nowhere near acceptable' - Dyche bemoans 'awful' goals
articles.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche is critical of defensive mistakes as they lose 3-1 at Leeds United in the Premier League.

articles.title: Calvert-Lewin the 'perfect goalscorer' - Farke
articles.summary: Manager Daniel Farke is full of praise for striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, who scored as Leeds United beat Nottingham Forest 3-1 in the Premier League.

articles.title: Putellas' future? Chelsea's quiet window? Emma Sanders Q&A
articles.summary: BBC Sport reporter Emma Sanders takes fans' questions on the Women's Super League, the transfer window and the future of Alexia Putellas.
